modules.description: Writes data to a file in batches using a specified filename, appending multidimensional arrays in C layout. Operates on Bigarray.Genarray.t structures for efficient numerical data handling. Used to persist large datasets incrementally during scientific computations or data processing pipelines.

Provides functions to open, read, and close NPZ files, with support for retrieving entries and reading array data using a specified suffix. Operates on in_file and out_file types, handling Bigarray.Genarray.t for binary data storage. Used to load and save numerical arrays from compressed numpy files in scientific computing workflows.

Writes OCaml bigarrays to .npy files following the version 1.0 specification, enabling interoperability with Python's numpy. Operates on multidimensional arrays stored in bigarray structures. Used to persist OCaml numerical data for analysis or processing in Python environments.

Writes data to files in batches using C-layout multidimensional arrays, supporting incremental storage of large numerical datasets. Reads and writes compressed numpy files, enabling retrieval of array data via specified suffixes. Operates on Bigarray.Genarray.t for efficient numerical processing and in_file/out_file types for file management. Can persist scientific computations or load pre-saved arrays for analysis.
